item.title: Uncertain Project Estimation
item.description: What makes project estimation so difficult? Proper project estimation can be as much of an art as it is a science. Artistically, it requires that gut reaction when a seemingly simple project carries with it complexity undertones unseen. Scientifically however, it should be interpreted more like statistics than basic arithmetic. I say this because statistics is bound tightly to the principle of uncertainty and uncertainty is a highly valuable concept when understanding and communicating project commitments.
